intro: Dimorphochlamys mannii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a distinctive two-lobed calyx that gives it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
